gurmukhi: ieiq sRI rudR pRbMD d`C bDh rudR mhwqmy gaur bDh ]iDAwie XwrwN sMpUrnm squ suBm squ ]11]
transliteration: It(i) Srirudra Prabandh Dachchh Badhah Rudra Mahaatamaa Gaddd Badhah|| Dhiaae Yaaraan Sanpooranam Sat(u) Soubham Sat(u)||11||
translation: End of the description of the Killing of Daksha, the greatness of rudra and the Killing of Gauri (Parvati) in the Rudra incarnation.11.
Now begins the description of Jalandhar incarnation:
Let Sri Bhagauti Ji (The Primal Lord) be helpful.

gurmukhi: vhu jo jrI ru`dR kI dwrw ]iqn ihm igr giH ilX Avqwrw ]
transliteration: Vahu Jo Jariruddra Kidaaraa|| Tin Him Gir Grih Liya Avtaaraa||
translation: After having been burnt and died, the wife of Rudra was born in the house of Himalaya.

gurmukhi: CutI bwlqw jb suiD AweI ]bhuro imlI nwQ kh jweI ]1]
transliteration: Chhoutibaaltaa Jab Sudh(i) Aaee|| Bahuro Milinaath Kah Jaaee||1||
translation: After the end of her childhood, when she attained the age of puberty, she was again united with her Lord Shiva.1.

gurmukhi: ijh ibD imlI rwm so sIqw ]jYsk cqur byd qn gIqw ]
transliteration: Jih Bidh Miliraam So Seetaa|| Jaisak Chatur Bed Tan Geetaa||
translation: Just as Sita, on meeting Rama, became one with him; just as Gita and Vedic ideology are one;

gurmukhi: jYsy imlq isMD qn gMgw ]qXoN imil geI rudR kY sMgw ]2]
transliteration: Jaise Milat Sindh Tan Gadgad|| Tyon Mil(i) Gadrudra Kai Sanad||2||
translation: Just as, on meeting the sea, the Ganges becomes one with the sea, in the same manner, Parvati and Shiva became one.2.

gurmukhi: jb iqh bXwh rudR Gr Awnw ]inrK jlMDr qwih luBwnw ]
transliteration: Jab Tih Byaah Rudra Ghar Aanaa|| Nirakh Jalandhar Taah(i) Loubhaanaa||
translation: When, after wedding, Rudra brought her to his home, the demon Jalandhar was allured on seeing her;

gurmukhi: dUq eyk qh dIXo pTweI ]ilAwau rudR qy nwr iCnweI ]3]
transliteration: Doot Ek Tah Deeyo Pathaaee|| Liaao Rudra Te Naar Chhinaaee||3||
translation: He sent a messenger , saying this: “Go and bring that women, after seizing her from Rudra.”3.

gurmukhi: kY isv nwih sINgwrkY mm giH dyh pTwie ]nwqr sUl sMBwrkY sMg lrhu mur Awie ]4]
transliteration: Kai Siv Daar(i) Seengadr-kai Mam Grih Deh Pathaae|| Naatar Sool Sanbhaar-kai Sandaroh Mur Aae||4||
translation: Jalandhar told his messenger to say this to Shiva : “O Shiva, either send your bedecked wife to me, or hold up your trident and wage war with me.”4.
